Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities lean forward ► in order to reach out to those in need of their intervention
= action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot or carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

= hole in the ground, big enough to hold a person and deep enough that a person cannot climb out; ◄ usually dug out of the ground or hewn from rock; ► often used to collect and store rain water; ≈ fresh water from a spring is considered superior to stagnant water from a cistern
= process by which turbulent waters produce a loud and intimidating noise

= wet soil;◄ moistened by rain or because of its proximity to a body of water; ► can be used for pottery or bricks; ≈ regarded as cheap, easily obtainable and workable material for making basic items; otherwise as a valueless substance or an obstacle for movement
= wet soil; ◄ moistened because of its proximity to water; ≈ regarded as an obstacle for movement
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
literally: to establish (someone's) ways or steps; hence: = causative action by which deities cause the activities of humans to be faithful and in line with the will of God

literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state in which objects or event have attained a certain state for only a short time
= songs in which action humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= state in which humans have confidence in someone or something else and show that by their actions; ≈ usually regarded as negative when the object is human, always positive when the object is YHWH
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
= action by which humans depart from the right pattern of behavior
literally: falsehood; hence: = things that cannot be trusted
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which events happen with a large frequency

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= an offering consisting of grain or a grain product, which usually accompanies an animal sacrifice
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
literally: to hew out two ears; hence, probably: = causative action by which deities cause humans to be willing and obedient by giving them ears that are willing to listen
= action by which a human being brings a sacrifice with the intention of making atonement for a wrongful act against God, whether committed on purpose or not
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= long strip of writing material made by sewing together sheets of papyrus or parchment; this strip was then rolled up from one end or from both ends to form one or two cylinders; usually the ends of the scroll were attached to sticks, around which the scroll was rolled; an unrolled scroll was often about 10 meters in length and stood approximately 23 25 centimeters high; the term מְגִלַּת־סֵפֶר seems to be the more complete term for a book scroll, as it occurs at the beginning of passages in which scrolls play a roll; the shorter term מְגִלָּה is used after that
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

literally = the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion
= action by which humans pass on information to someone else, having been commissioned to do so by a deity or another person

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
literally: to confine (someone from doing something); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep (other) humans from engaging in a certain activity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
literally: to cover (information); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities keep certain information hidden from others
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their actions
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need
= action by which humans refer to a particular object when speaking
= causative action by which humans refrain from sharing information with others

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
literally: to confine (oneself from doing something); hence: = action by which deities keep themselves from engaging in a certain activity
= state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary
= process by which something happens to someone to such an extent that it is overwhelming
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: there is no counting (of it); hence: = state in which events cannot be counted or measured because of their frequency or intensity

literally: to overtake; hence: = process by which events that humans have been expecting or dreading finally take place, ◄ as if they had been pursuing them for some time and ultimately caught up with them
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which events happen with a large frequency

= the fine thread like strands growing from the skin of humans and certain animals; ≈ one single strand can be used as a symbol for a very small distance or quantity, whereas the collective of strands often symbolizes a great quantity

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier
= action by which someone performs an event quickly

Node.gloss: to be ashamed|to come to shame|to be put to shame|to be disappointed
Node.definition: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status
= process by which humans experience a strong emotion of shame
= state in which multiple events are connected
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to experience a feeling of shame
= state in which humans feel emotionally attached to a particular event
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= marker expressing satisfaction
= marker expressing satisfaction
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= action where humans make an intensive effort to associate with a deity, to serve and worship him, and to get answers to questions

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which humans or deities increase in status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

Node.gloss: to think of|to have regard for
Node.definition: = state/process by which humans or deities consider something or someone valuable or of interest
= action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

Node.gloss: to delay|to linger|to stay|to be slow
Node.definition: = to do something later than expected
